page.title: 08TONY IRESON OF BEECH COTTAGE
page.content: Mr Ireson moved into Beech Cottage in 1947.Beech Cottage had a large beautiful garden.Mr Ireson realised his house and garden were in danger in 1960.He found out from paper and radio issues.Tanners Lane needed to be redirected to act as a service road for the new shopping centre.After many talks Mr Ireson talks managed to persuade the council that they did not need the land on which the cottage stood,but the garden had to go.On July 2nd 1974 the demolision began.Mr.Ireson was cross that a beautiful garden of an English cottage should be destroyed for the sake of modern development.Today Beech Cottage stands as a symbol of Kettering's past.The garden has been reduced to a small triangular patch of flowers,but Mr.Ireson would never wish to leave.
